channel.title: Sleep Learning
channel.description: Did anyone ever try this? Did it work?

item.title: Sleep Learning
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“magma828, post:1, topic:214963”][quote author=Javacisnotrecognized link=topic=281984.msg2294392#msg2294392 date=1214333972]

dual core brain ffs

If that were the case, it’d be possible to sleep while awake.
[/quote]
Isn’t that called meditation?[/quote]

Whoa. That’s deep.

[quote=“jme, post:20, topic:214311”][quote author=Javacisnotrecognized link=topic=281984.msg2294392#msg2294392 date=1214333972]

dual core brain ffs

If that were the case, it’d be possible to sleep while awake.
[/quote]

That is possible, but probably different than what you are thinking.[/quote]

What do you mean ?

Read full topic

item.title: Sleep Learning
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

I would imagine if your brain was preoccupied learning/remembering things while it should be repairing braincells or some shit like that, wouldn’t you wake up just as tired as when you went to sleep ?

Read full topic

item.title: Sleep Learning
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:

It seemed to have worked in Flowers for Algernon…
[/quote]
That’s not a true story.[/quote]
IT’S A GOVERNMENT CONSPIRACY!!111

item.title: Sleep Learning
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“magma828, post:1, topic:214752”][quote author=cooper link=topic=281984.msg2293062#msg2293062 date=1214268218]

I’ve never tried it.
I never will.
I take the time to actually sit down and study, plus I can’t sleep with any sort of noise going.

Yeah it does seem strange how you could actually learn something while sleeping. It might work for remembering formulas but not for understanding things. I can sleep with quite a bit of background noise now because of two years running servers in my room

Why do you run them in your room? I leave mine in the home office downstairs.
[/quote]
Tried the exact same thing but they just kept getting turned off by some tard who can’t get it into their head that the computers stay on 24/7.[/quote]
Oh, that stinks :\

Read full topic

item.title: Sleep Learning
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:

I’ve never tried it.
I never will.

I take the time to actually sit down and study, plus I can’t sleep with any sort of noise going.
[/quote]

Yeah it does seem strange how you could actually learn something while sleeping. It might work for remembering formulas but not for understanding things. I can sleep with quite a bit of background noise now because of two years running servers in my room :)[/quote]
Why do you run them in your room? I leave mine in the home office downstairs.

Read full topic

item.title: Sleep Learning
item.dc:creator: @Doggie3342 Doggie3342
item.description:
@Doggie3342 wrote:

io9:

It seemed to have worked in Flowers for Algernon…

worked in Brave New World too.
ive heard and read that it can help you remember things, but it wont help you use them or relate them to other concepts.

Read full topic
